posts.cooked:
Hi,
today happened something really strange on my signal desktop.

An all groups it said “You were removed from the group.”
but this looked like an error as the groups are totally unrelated and it is unlikely that something happens across all groups simultaneously.

Then I checked on my android phone and the groups worked fine there.

I checked also if the signal-desktop device was still listed in the linked devices page on the phone - and it was.

Then I added a second signal-desktop by linking it with the QR code scan on the phone and a few minutes later the “You were removed from the group.” appeared also there on the new device.

Now it appears to toggle randomly:

  • “You were removed from the group.”
  • You joined the group
  • “You were removed from the group.”

signal-desktop version: 7.37.0
OS: Debian 12

Same problem here, but also on Android running Molly FOSS! Running Signal Desktop on a Debian based distro likewise.

since a few hours I’m running into an issue, where upon clicking on any group I’m part of, the message “You were removed from the group” shows up on both Signal Android and Signal-Desktop. Trying to send a message gets me “You are no longer part of the group”. Other group members still see me as part of the group. Group chats I don’t click still receive messages.
This is the case on multiple accounts and devices of mine. Asked fellow Group member to remove and add me back to a group. Results in receiving messages which have been sent after I got the “You are no longer part of the group” in the first place and immediately after those messages from the meantime again “You are no longer part of the group”.

environment of my Signal Desktops:

========= System info =========
App version: 7.37.0
Arch: x64
Environment: production
Linux version: “Freedesktop SDK 24.08 (Flatpak runtime)”
Node version: 20.18.1
OS version: #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Wed Dec 11 17:56:03 GMT 2024
Time: 1736805181109
User agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Signal/7.37.0 Chrome/130.0.6723.137 Electron/33.2.1 Safari/537.36

Flatpak 1.14.10

org.signal.Signal commit: 07a0b4693558af265c5a9c76e6dd645f77b7cc1a7ccf5711246933bba8678efe

@signaluser0 could you take a look into your debug log (View->Debug Log> Save) for any related errors?

I got the same ‘you were removed from group’ error, but on my android device. running Molly-foss client.

I reset my Molly,(v7.28.4-1-foss) restored my backup from yesterday. and again, as soon as I entered the group, on my client only, I received ‘you were removed from group’. however, another group member listing, I am still listed as a member on their client.

Why is this happening?

Debug log: openSUSE Paste

This is happening to me as well, beginning at 7pm UTC on Jan 13. Every time I open a group chat, I see the message “You are no longer in the group.” and am no longer able to send messages to the group.

I am using Signal 7.24.2. I have 0 linked devices. If I disconnect from data and open a group chat, then I do not see the message until I reconnect.

I am getting removed even from groups that I am an admin of. Others in the group have no knowledge that I have been removed, as I still appear on the member list. Having someone else remove me and then re-add me fixes the issue. In one group, I was able to send a single message before I started getting the “Send failed” error with a red exclamation mark on outgoing messages.
Anything related in Molly’s debug log?
trying to upload it, need some time
Can you provide a debug log? And which Application: Signal for Android, Molly,…? So we can check for similarities in the log,

So I posted the debug log in my original msg post.

here it is again

https://paste.opensuse.org/pastes/de965b1916ff

No related stuff so far on Molly nor Signal Desktop repo, might be good place to file an issue there as well?

looks like throwing this GroupNotAMemberException could be related to our issues?
but why did it happen? so weird.

Good question. I’m just trying to find any clues which could be related Warning or Error in the debug log. Not too familiar with Signal to give an answer on what is the issue at hand.
Educated guessing would be it does not seem to be related to an Update of the client applications mentioned (Signal Desktop, Molly FOSS). And it did occur simultaneously around 7 pm UTC for some of us. So my guess would be its got something to do with the Signal Server and how it is handling Group memberships?

The 403 somehow bothers me, its the HTTP status code forbidden. So maybe insufficient permission to access. Could be bug on the server side, or maybe some users a blocked related to the client’s user agent they are using (would explain why so far only Signal Desktop and Molly have been mentioned…, or maybe IP range block? I’m not accessing the Internet directly. Any of you are using VPN or Tor?

yes, i am using invizible pro android, but using socks proxy to get out.

my contact still lists me as a member, but when i had then remove, readd me, they got msg, i was removed again.

i dare not enter my other groups just yet, otherwise, i will be removed from group

Found two commits for 7.38.0-beta1 which could have an effect maybe?

so it’s worth a try to install signal desktop beta alongside signal desktop and link it with ur master device and check it out. but i’m just guessing here.

posts.cooked:
Here is a github issue related to this problem: Removed from all groups · Issue #7130 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

It seems that the server refuses group API endpoints (403 errors) for clients through Tor or Riseup VPN (desktop on Tails or with VPN ; Android with Orbot)
So the client displays the message “You were removed from group”, but from the server point of view you’re still on the group and so the main device can still receive messages

Because it’s dependant on the server, all clients can be affected, updated or not.

link_counts.title: Removed from all groups · Issue #7130 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

posts.cooked: So what does this all mean? What can I do to fix this, or is it a devops fix?

posts.name: kara
posts.cooked: The last reply in the github issue says the problem was (hopefully) fixed by a server-side config change.
